title: 104_hr3470
content: The Act is titled the "Minnesota National Treasures Conservation and Protection Act." It includes findings related to the conservation and protection of national treasures. The Congress recognizes Voyageurs National Park and the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness as special natural resources deserving national preservation and protection. Congress has shown strong support for these areas through designation and funding. The Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness is widely used and highly valued as a wilderness unit. The Congress recognizes the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness as a highly valued wilderness unit with significant esthetic, cultural, scientific, recreational, and educational value to the Nation, necessitating orderly administration and management for public use while preserving its special qualities. The Congress recognizes the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness as a highly valued wilderness unit with significant esthetic, cultural, scientific, recreational, and educational value to the Nation, necessitating orderly administration and management for public use while preserving its special qualities. TITLE I--THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS PRESERVATION SEC. 101. BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS DESIGNATION AND MAP. The amendment to Public Law 94-495 designates the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness as comprising approximately 1,101,000 acres. The deadline for this designation is now tied to the enactment of the Minnesota National Treasures Conservation and Protection Act. The map and description of the Wilderness must be filed with specific congressional committees. SEC. 102 amends Section 4 of Public Law 95-495 regarding Basswood and Jackfish Bay. SEC. 103 applies Executive Order 10092 to specified areas on a map referenced in the Act. The Voyageurs National Park Preservation Act designates the Kabetogama Peninsula within Voyageurs National Park in Minnesota as wilderness, comprising approximately 74,114 acres. It shall be known as the "Voyageurs National Park Wilderness." The Act also includes a map and legal description of the designated area. SEC. 202 of the Act requires the Secretary of the Interior to file a map and legal description of the designated wilderness area with specific committees in Congress. The map and legal description will be available for public inspection at the National Park Service office and the Voyageurs National Park Superintendent's office. SEC. 203 of the Act states that the designated wilderness area will be administered by the Secretary of the Interior in accordance with the Wilderness Act. Existing safety portages for snowmobiles will continue to be used as depicted on the map referenced in section 201.
